page.description: Returns the record number of the current record.

argument.name: tablename
argument.description: Optional. Default = current or primary table. The name of a table.

page.discussion: RECNO() returns the record number of the current record in the specified table.

section.example: "R" + ltrim( str( recno("Product") ) ) + ltrim( str( recno("Vendor") ) )

section.description: Note : Using the record number to create a unique record ID is not a good idea. The value returned by RECNO() is only a physical position in a table. It can change if you delete a record and then pack the table.

section.title: How to display the current record number

item.description: While your form is in design mode, click to create a calculated field.
Give the field a unique name.
In the Expression field enter RECNO().
Drag the new field from the Drag and Drop List onto your form.
